column5: Well what an amazing day!!!  Thank you sooo much fishmaster for my first try at Salmon fishing.  None of us will ever forget it.  And let me just confirm what everyone always says.  This man is just awesome at what he does.  I swear he didn't stop all day!!  Heck I even packed enough lunch for him and his first mate and they didn't even stop to eat for crying out loud.  LOL and no it wasn't my cooking haha coldcuts  Just wanted to share some pics and smiles of our day.              Oh and what day of my fishing would be complete without..........    LOL......seeing how I have now developed a reputation for running around and kissing fish hahahaha
Good stuff!!  Nice fish and it looks like it was a perfect day weather wise.  Joey
Awesome report. Looks like you had a perfect day on the Lake... The colours on the fish in the last picture are amazing... WTG !!  Cheers,  Jen

RIGHT ...ON..  ..way to go,looks like it was a great fishing trip,and they are nice fish for sure,gotta love lake ontario,she always produces big time,great report & pics thanks for sharing them....cheers
fun stuff!  looks like a great day!  cheers!
Im glad you 4 enjoyed your trip FC.....can't beat a day like that on the water for a $20 ticket.....i have a few other pics ill try to post them later today ..Fishmaster
Great job out there!  Awesome looking pics...and the smiles says it all.  I know what charter I'll be hiring if I ever come across some spare money...LOL.

I know eh....best 20 bucks I ever spent.  We are all already talking about paying full price and heading out again for sure.  Maybe just a girls trip...lol.....seeing how I out fished all the boys  hahaha gotta love it
Looks like an awesome day!  Thanks for the report.
Right on...FC. 'Bout time you caught something  . Keep kissing fish and you'll end up with giardia. Alright, alright congrats.
I know eh.....not to shabby for a Markham chick eh J...........So are ya gonna fill me in where all the locals spots to fish are now that you moved away to yuppyville!! lol  :whistling:
Great report and nice pics. They dont call him fishmaster for nothing. He knows where the fish are at. Good job!
